ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Intensive is definitely a big time commitment but worth it in my opinion. Especially because the extra lab credit will probably be more chill/flexible than any class you'd take
I learned so much about laboratory techniques, concepts, and teamwork.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Don't see the need in writing a grant proposal at the end of the fall semester on top of a thesis in the spring. Especially since they expect us to start from scratch each time
The Course is entirely dependent on your PI

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Intensive is definitely a big time commitment but worth it in my opinion. Especially because the extra lab credit will probably be more chill/flexible than any class you'd take
Yes! You learn so much about research and achieve an in-depth understanding.

Do you like research? Do you like your PI and your lab, and want to spend 20 hours a week there? If so, definitely take this, because I don't think 10 hours/week is enough to have a fulfilling research experience. Personally I loved it, and the freedom from classes (since this is two credits, I only had to take 2 others) gave me a lot of time to focus on my labwork. However, if research isn't for you, then maybe this isn't the best idea.
